rminte: R Interface to Python's MINTe Package

Source: R/rminte-package.R
rminte-package.Rd

An R interface to the Python 'minte' package, providing neural network-based malaria scenario predictions for evaluating intervention strategies including ITNs (Insecticide-Treated Nets), IRS (Indoor Residual Spraying), and LSM (Larval Source Management).

Main Functions

  • run_minter_scenarios: Main entry point for running scenarios

  • run_mintweb_controller: Simplified web interface controller

  • run_malaria_emulator: Direct emulator interface

  • plot_prevalence: Plot prevalence over time (ggplot2)

  • plot_cases: Plot cases over time (ggplot2)

Utility Functions

  • calculate_overall_dn0: Calculate net effectiveness

  • available_net_types: Get supported net types

  • preload_all_models: Pre-load models into cache

  • clear_cache: Clear model cache

Setup

  • minte_available: Check if minte is available

  • install_minte: Install minte Python package

See also

Useful links:

  • https://github.com/mrc-ide/rminte

  • https://mrc-ide.github.io/rminte/

  • Report bugs at https://github.com/mrc-ide/rminte/issues
